sense.name: the act of traversing a space, moving from one side to the other
sense.examples: Crossing the street at this place is particularly hazardous. Our company's crossing of a major milestone in sales was celebrated at an office party. Their crossing of the mountains was done in the dead of winter.

sense.name: a shallow area of water, a ford
sense.examples: This shallow portion of the river is a favorite cattle crossing.

sense.name: a single point of intersection on two lines
sense.examples: Draw an X at the crossing of the two lines on this map. The diagram was a confusion of crossing lines and overlapping circles. My map shows no crossing of Main Street with Juniper Lane.

sense.name: a designated path traversing a roadway
sense.examples: A traffic cop stood in the crossing, letting the pedestrians pass. Cars will be fined $300 for stopping in a crossing at a red light. All railroad crossings must have automatic barriers and flashing lights.

sense.name: genetic hybridization
sense.examples: A mule is a crossing between a horse and a donkey.

sense.name: a journey over water that is a completed traversal
sense.examples: There are no ferry crossings on Sunday. Our Atlantic crossing took ten days.

sense.name: designated checkpoint at an international border
sense.examples: They picked up the two men at the crossing in Brownsville, Texas.
